snippet: Mass shootings are not the typical face of gun violence — some 90 people a day are lost to guns — but there is little consensus on addressing the bigger picture.
abstract: Mass shooting in Roseburg, Ore, has once again sparked debate about availability of legal guns in country, but experts note mass shootings are not most common form of gun violence that claims lives of around 30 people each day across nation; evidence suggests guns used in homicides are most often stolen, which complicates debate over whether stricter background check policies will have meaningful effect.
lead_paragraph: Mass shootings are not the typical face of gun violence — some 90 people a day are lost to guns — but there is little consensus on addressing the bigger picture.

headline.main: Rampage Killings Linger in Memory, but Toll of Gun Violence Is Constant
headline.print_headline: Rampage Killings Linger in Memory, but Toll of Gun Violence Is Constant
